general.subject: Confirm Your Options
general.body:
Hello Mohammed,

One final step to update your options. Read and confirm below.

You agree that DP World may collect, use and disclose your personal data which you have provided in this form, for providing job alerts and recruiting marketing material that you have agreed to receive, in accordance with our data protection policy [available at link]. Click the below link to confirm that you agree to receive: Marketing Communications, Job Alerts (CX_1)

Confirm your options 

Sincerely,
DP World Recruiting Team

promotion.subject: Improve supply chain accuracy with self-service analytics
promotion.body:
Thought Leadership

Tips for Optimizing Supply Chain Planning

Hi Mohammed,

Consumers aren’t the only ones susceptible to ‘panic buying’. Ordering too many products to avoid inventory stockouts is a common, but costly challenge in supply chain operations.

Learn how <https://email.alteryx.com/Nzc1LUJQTi0wMjIAAAGbYwIAhP6r-8eqlCNShcp5tuGXEa7NcrXhg4GfzBZe1W4GjkWA3yELoJ1ljpWywSLdx3VRD4U=> to reduce the risk and revenue loss associated with overstocks with tips from supply chain experts.

Plus, learn from supply chain thought leaders how to assess the quality of supply chain processes and leverage technology to improve demand planning.

Read Now - https://www.alteryx.com/blog/is-your-organization-gaming-supply-chain-planning?utm_source=marketo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=FY25_Global_AllRegions_LifecycleMarketing_SupplyChain_Manufacturing_email_nurture&utm_content=EM1_main_offer

Check out this Alter.Everything Podcast episode with Susan Walsh, The Classification Guru, where she joins us to talk about fixing dirty data in the supply chain.

Watch Now - https://community.alteryx.com/t5/Alter-Everything-Podcast/167-Fixing-Dirty-Data-in-the-Supply-Chain/ba-p/1317393?utm_source=marketo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=FY25_Global_AllRegions_LifecycleMarketing_SupplyChain_Manufacturing_nurture&utm_content=secondoffer

Subject: 💼 Rahul Agarwal wants to connect with you on LinkedIn

Body:

Hi Mohammed,

Rahul Agarwal, Software Engineer at TCS, has sent you a connection request on LinkedIn.

He wrote:
"Hi Mohammed, I came across your profile and was impressed with your work in AI. I’d love to connect and stay in touch!"

👉 View Invitation

Cheers,
— The LinkedIn Team

spam.subject: Subject: Unclaimed Funds Notification - Immediate Action Required!
paragraphs: We are writing to inform you about an unclaimed funds of $50,000 that has been traced back to your name in our system. This sum is the result of a recent financial audit conducted by our company and we have been unable to locate the rightful owner.

In order to release these funds to you, we require some personal information to verify your identity. This includes your full name, date of birth, current address, and contact number. Once we receive this information, we will be able to process the payment and transfer the funds to your designated bank account.

Please be advised that if we do not hear back from you within 7 days, we will be obligated to forfeit these funds to the government. We strongly recommend that you take advantage of this opportunity before it is too late.

If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us at [support@example.com](mailto:support@example.com) or by phone at 1-800-555-5555. We are available 24/7 to assist you with any inquiries you may have.
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

Dear Customer,

We noticed suspicious activity in your bank account. To avoid account suspension, please verify your details immediately by clicking the link below:

Failure to do so will result in permanent closure of your account.

Regards,  
FakeBank Security Team
